utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that was interminable. How are fifteen PowerPoint presentations a unique research opportunity? You guys said crime stat briefings were fascinating.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you guys told him that?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I’m sure they’re fascinating to someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my … you lied to me. I just squandered three hours of my life.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So did we. Oh, come on, Castle. No hard feelings. I tell you what. I will buy the first round at the Old Haunt.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry guys, I can’t tonight. I have another security gig with my brother-in-law.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Again?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. The good news is Sarah Grace will have enough money for college. The bad news is she’ll have no idea who I am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who’re you guarding this time?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … truth is, I’m not allowed to say.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean, you’re not allowed to say? It’s us. Who is it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Seriously, man. I can’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That means this goes beyond the usual pro athlete or reality star. This is someone important. Someone revered. Perhaps … the Pope. The Dalai Lama. Angela Merkel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: My lips are sealed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan! Is it One Direction? You’d tell me, right? Are they in town?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, they’re in Hong Kong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, how’s my sister doing?

utterance.speaker: FRANK KELLY
utterance.content: Sleeping easier, now that I’ve retired from the force.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t miss the job at all, working vice?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Nah. I was dealing with lowlifes every freaking minute. Now I’m my own boss. I’m telling you, Kev, security is a better way of life.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I have to say, a lot of guys, when they retire, they just drift. But you’re really making this work.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: You could make it work for you, too.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Anyhow, there’s a permanent spot for you, with me, the minute you make the call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wow, Frank. That’s a hell of an offer.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: With your background I’d be lucky to have you. Now tell me, did you memorize the rogues' gallery?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Every face. So what’s the threat level here?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Low. It’s a charity event for Pure Water Now, it’s not a middle east peace conference. There’s going to be protesters wanting to bother Congressman Lopez. You’ve heard of him, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Who hasn’t? He’s a rising member of the House, super charismatic. Though let’s face it, there’s not a hell of a lot of competition in that.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: He’s still a standup guy. Every time he comes to the city he hires me, so treat him right. He’s going places.

utterance.speaker: ALEX LOPEZ
utterance.content: What’s our ETA, Frank?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Just a few more minutes, sir. Detective Kevin Ryan, Congressman Alex Lopez.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Frank speaks very highly of you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As he does of you, sir.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Please, call me Alex. Or Mr. Lopez if you want. My wife, Mia. You’ve met my Chief of Staff, Megan Brooks. Kevin, what do you think your job is tonight?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: To protect you, sir.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Mostly it’s my reputation you need to protect. These days a single photo can cause major damage if some idiot approaches, tries to create a scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll make sure that doesn’t happen, sir.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Good. Because come campaign season I may need some men I can rely on.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN BROOKS
utterance.content: Sir, about tonight’s schedule. It’s the red carpet and then mingling over cocktails. Uh, these are the people you’re going to want to connect with. Some of them you know, all of them are major donors with their own super-PACs still looking for a candidate they can believe in. I’ve broken down all their past campaign contributions and net worth.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I hope all these rich guys are ready to fork over some money to Carolyn and her Pure Water project.

utterance.speaker: MIA LOPEZ
utterance.content: Well they are, darling. But the real reason they’re coming is to see you.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Okay, after meet and greets you’re going to take the stage and introduce Carolyn, and here is your speech.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Excuse me, folks. We’re pulling in now.

utterance.speaker: BREE COLTON
utterance.content: Congressman Lopez, is there any truth to the rumor that you’re launching a presidential campaign?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: No, Bree, tonight is all about my very good friend Carolyn Decker and her Pure Water project. She’s going to be providing clean water for families all over the globe.

utterance.speaker: CAROLYN DECKER
utterance.content: Work that is only possible because of the support and generosity of people like Alex Lopez.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What is this, blood? What were you going to do, spray him with it?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: The drone strikes that he supports kill innocent children.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detain him and get him out of here.

utterance.speaker: CAROLYN
utterance.content: Nice work. You might find yourself protecting the first Latino president of the United States.

utterance.speaker: JIM BOYCE
utterance.content: Ha ha ha … there he is.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Congratulations, Jim. State Party chairman? It’s a great fit for you.

utterance.speaker: BOYCE
utterance.content: Well, thank you for all your support, Alex. You know I’ll have your back when you make a run for that White House.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Little too soon for that kind of talk, but I appreciate the thought.

utterance.speaker: BOYCE
utterance.content: Enjoy your evening.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Likewise.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Mr. Sheldon, it’s a pleasure to see you.

utterance.speaker: CARL SHELDON
utterance.content: You’re being very coy about your aspirations, Alex. But you obviously have some or you wouldn’t be here.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Well now, I’m just happy to serve the people of my district.

utterance.speaker: SHELDON
utterance.content: Being coy isn’t in my nature. You and your ideas aren’t what this country needs. And I’ll see to it that you never become president.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Nice talking to you.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Oh, Aryana Jones, this is Alex Lopez.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Aryana, my wife and I are huge fans. Can’t wait to see the performance tonight.

utterance.speaker: ARYANA JONES
utterance.content: You are too sweet, Alex. Please come say hi after the show.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Uh, sir? Five minutes until you’re on. You better get backstage.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Bye.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Give me some room, fellas. I’d like a word with Carolyn.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, Lopez is a rock star.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re telling me. All right, I’ll keep eyes on him on stage. You got him back here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, copy that.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: God, I think I’ve been hit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, stay right where you are. Help’s on the way, okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Carolyn?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Carolyn! You’re going to be all right.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Kev? Kev, what the hell happened?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Call 911! We need a doctor in here right now.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Who did this? You see who did this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. No, no, no, no. Stop! Grey suit! Stay right where you are.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Stop that man! Police! Move out of the way, move out of the way!

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: Drop the weapon! Drop the weapon!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The shooter’s getting away!

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: Put the gun down now or I’ll shoot!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, how’s Lopez?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Lucky. Round hit his collarbone but missed his heart.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How about Carolyn Decker?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Still in surgery.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I took my eyes off him for one second –

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No, no, no, Kev. We are going to find this shooter. NYPD sealed off ten square blocks from this place.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did we get a description?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Only the one you gave us. Six feet, medium build, brown hair.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on, no one saw his face?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah, they did. But they were too busy panicking to remember.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Look, why don’t we walk through what happened?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, Frank, I already did that.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: And what’s the harm in doing it again?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Shots rang out. Three of them. I – I dove on Lopez, took Carolyn down, too. Saw they were hit, that’s when you came in –

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: - and then I spotted the shooter. I only ever saw their back.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: All right, think about his hands. Rings on his fingers? A watch?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no. Wait. Uh … blue card. Yeah, he had a pale blue ID card hanging from his neck. This guy had a press pass.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Kev. That’s good. I’m going to brief NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bad news travels fast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not really. Can we talk later?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Kev, this can’t wait.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, I have to work this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, it’s a homicide now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m at the hospital. Carolyn Decker just died in surgery. Kev? Are you there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I read your statement. We should talk about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no. There’s no point. I never saw the shooter’s face, but hey. Have you talked to Lopez yet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The shooter was in his line of sight. If anyone saw him it was Lopez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’m on it. I’ll call you as soon as I know something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry sir, this area is off limits.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m very sorry, sir.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Kev?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Any luck on that press pass? Who’d it belong to?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean, no one?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Event security kept extra passes on hold for last minute attendees. Somehow our shooter got ahold of one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how’s Ryan doing? He knows it’s not his fault, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it happened on his watch, so for Ryan it means it’s all on him until he finds this guy.

utterance.speaker: JIM BOYCE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Jim Boyce. State party chair. This whole thing is just terrible. Is there any news?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just that we’re doing everything we can to apprehend the suspect.

utterance.speaker: BOYCE
utterance.content: Well, I’m glad that you’re the one handling the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Mr. Boyce, do we know each other?

utterance.speaker: BOYCE
utterance.content: No, but you have an outstanding reputation and it’s gotten the attention of the people in my world. I won’t hold you, Detective. Pleasure to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Likewise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was that about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Maybe we can set up a foundation in Carolyn’s name.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Yes. Let’s do that. Like a scholarship fund.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Why don’t I look into that and get back to you with options?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: That’d be great, Megan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Congressman Lopez, I’m Detective Beckett, this is Mr. Castle. We’re investigating the shooting.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: You know, as a politician you know in the back of your mind that harm may come to you. But it should never come to an innocent bystander.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Congressman, did you notice anything or anyone suspicious prior to the shooting?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Everything seemed normal. Until it wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we believe that the shots originated from the north end of the backstage area.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the direction you were facing when you were speaking with Carolyn Decker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you notice anyone in the background?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I saw … stage hands … production crew … there was this one guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was he wearing?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: A grey suit. Is that him? Is that the man who killed Carolyn?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see his face? Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I can most definitely describe him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is our guy, Eric Chambers. French blogger and political activist with some pretty extreme ideas.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, he looks like the sketch. But can we place him at the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU pulled Chambers' print off the wall, so he was there. It was definitely him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m guessing he’s not a big supporter of Lopez?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s an understatement. Two weeks ago Chambers ranted on his blog about how Lopez posed a threat to the American way of life and that he would get what all traitors deserve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Chambers now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His last known address was in the Bowery. Tactical’s gearing up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take Ryan. He should be there when you pick Chambers up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tactical’s about three minutes out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do we know Chambers is at home?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tory pinged his cell. He’s in there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, bro. We’re going to get this guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There he is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s on the move!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Chambers, freeze! Chambers!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Give me a reason!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Eric Chambers, you’re under arrest. We got him, Ryan. We’re good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Chambers, you are facing charges for murder and the attempted assassination of a congressman. Your best hope for leniency is to confess.

utterance.speaker: ERIC CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I’ll never confess. I won’t give you the satisfaction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you consider this a chance to tell your side of the story?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: My side of the story is that I’m innocent. This is all a charade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The evidence would suggest otherwise.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found this stolen press pass at your apartment along with a floorplan of the ballroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then there’s the pesky issue of you fleeing after firing the shots.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: A true patriot, by definition, is an enemy of the state. Our government has a long and sorry history of persecuting people like me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you are the victim here?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: And you’re the instrument they’re using to try to destroy me. You’re too blind to see that this is a script. You’re just playing your part.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ok – okay. Here’s the part that fascinates me. You hated Lopez, you wanted him dead, so you shot him. Not fatally, it turns out, but still, you struck a blow for – –“true patriots” everywhere. Isn’t this the proudest moment of your life, Eric? I mean, why not own it? Why not take credit for what you’ve accomplished?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want your day in court. So you can have a public forum.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I’m done here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Chambers isn’t talking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that may not matter. I think we literally just found the smoking gun.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get this: unis found a .38 caliber pistol in a storm drain about a block away from the hotel. Recently fired.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Weren’t there metal detectors at the venue?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, which means the gun might have been waiting for him, stashed at the hotel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Along with the press pass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that suggests he wasn’t acting alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Lopez might still be a target.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll call down to the hospital and beef up security.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we can reconstruct Chambers’ movements from the venue we might be able to figure out how he got that gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who he was working with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, when we were trying to ID Chambers we rounded up hundreds of photos from that event. I think I know where to start.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Some were taken by photographers, others by guests on their cell phones. I used facial recognition to try and search for Chambers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you find him?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: He appears in fourteen pictures, mostly in the background. Since each photo is time stamped, I was able to plot his movement at the venue. Each dot represents where Chambers was photographed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Does anyone in the photos ever hand him something? Does he ever retrieve an object the size of a gun?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I’m afraid not. But there is a five minute gap when Chambers is unaccounted for. This is the last photo before the missing time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That door leads to a storage area.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Then maybe that’s where the gun was stashed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. No, no. Security protocol would have had that door locked for the evening.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Well, this room wasn’t locked. Here’s another picture of it taken around the same time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That guy works for the hotel. That door was supposed to be locked. What was he doing in there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Julian Bailey?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN BAILEY
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You mind telling us what you were doing in the storage room last night?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: I wasn’t in any storage room.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh? Then who’s this? Your evil twin?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. I snuck in there for a girl, you know? We were going to meet up, but she never showed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. Have you seen this guy?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Yeah. He came in the room. I wasn’t supposed to be there, so I hid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was he doing in the room? Was he looking for something? Did he have a gun?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: A gun? No. He was with another dude. They were talking all intense.

utterance.speaker: CARL SHELTON
utterance.content: We have to be smart about where and when we bring Mr. Lopez down.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I’ve got it covered, okay? Lopez is going to get what’s coming to him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you didn’t think to mention this before?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: I was afraid I’d get fired. Besides, by the time I’d realized he was the one who shot the Congressman you guys had already caught him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, this other dude that he was talking to, did you see his face?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Just for a second as the two of them were walking out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Carl Shelton? As in, billionaire industrialist Carl Shelton?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And he’s no fan of Lopez. I saw Shelton tell Lopez to his face that he would never become president.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Shelton wanted to make sure so he colluded with Chambers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s starting to look that way. Especially since Shelton is co-owner of this hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he would have access to a press pass and know how to get a gun past security.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s money versus power. Tycoon versus politician. A story as old as America itself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s try and find out what the connection is between Eric Chambers and Carl Shelton.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: I’m afraid Mr. Shelton does not know anyone named Eric Chambers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we have a witness that saw the two of you talking to each other.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: That witness is mistaken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Shelton, you financed a group called America for Americans. It’s co-founded by Eric Chambers.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: My client –

utterance.speaker: CARL SHELTON
utterance.content: I fund many grassroots organizations who share my concern about the decline of this great nation. But I’m not acquainted with every person in every group.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eric Chambers' views are hard to miss. He advocates armed resistance against what he calls the US police state.

utterance.speaker: SHELTON
utterance.content: Well, there’s nothing wrong with ordinary Americans defending themselves against government overreach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, this isn’t about overreach. This is about you getting rid of a politician who stood against you.

utterance.speaker: SHELTON
utterance.content: Well, what is that, Mr. Castle? Your latest work of fiction?

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: I believe that concludes our interview. If you have more questions get a subpoena.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Shelton, you put Chambers up to this and I intend to prove it.

utterance.speaker: SHELTON
utterance.content: Good luck with that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up, bro? Everyone’s gone. What’re you still doing here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thinking.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on. This is a win. We got the shooter.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about Shelton?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll build a case against him. And I bet that Chambers will help us out and roll on Shelton.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why hasn’t he done that already?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Shelton made Chambers some promises in return for him keeping his mouth shut.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would a man in Shelton’s situation risk being seen with Chambers?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because. He’s like all these other rich sons of b*tches who think they can get away with anything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. Something about this just isn’t sitting right, Javi.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re spinning. You just need a good night’s sleep. In the morning everything will be clear to you. All right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Great. How about now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That looks good. Oh, good. You’re here!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is this? What are you guys … doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Well, Ryan was working all night and he texted me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You texted Castle and not me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, when you have a crazy theory you don’t call the voice of reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eric Chambers is not our shooter. We got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You’re telling me Eric Chambers is not our shooter? Based on what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Physics, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Congressman Lopez said that when he talked to Carolyn Decker he saw Chambers by the far wall.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which is where CSU found his prints.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seconds later our assassin opens fire. Three shots.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The first one strikes Lopez beneath the left clavicle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The second one grazes Carolyn Decker’s shoulder and then the third one strikes her in the upper back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That shot severs her pulmonary artery. She never has a chance.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: How does any of this lead you to think that Chambers is not the assassin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chambers' vantage point. He had a side angle view of Lopez and Carolyn Decker.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So how did Chambers manage to shoot Carolyn in the back? The answer is that he couldn’t have. Not unless that bullet took a hard right turn in midair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means the shots were fired from the grassy knoll. Metaphorically speaking.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, do you actually find any of this plausible?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir. Plausible enough that I’m getting ballistics to reevaluate the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Chambers had motive. He stole a press pass. He fled the shooting. How do you explain all that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think Chambers was set up to be the fall guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably by Carl Shelton.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then why isn’t he vigorously protesting his innocence?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chambers distrusts authority.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he believes that we’re part of a plot against him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Nonetheless, Eric Chambers remains our prime suspect unless proof comes in that he isn’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: In the meantime, sir, I’d like to take another run at him.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: You’re wasting your time. I’m not talking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that’s okay. You don’t have to talk. You can just listen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know that you’re not the shooter.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Of course you do. You people orchestrated the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, Eric, I got a news flash for you. You’re not the focus of some big governmental conspiracy. No one has the least bit of interest in you. Actually, I take that back. Someone is very interested in you. Whoever set you up. Somebody went to a significant amount of trouble to frame you and now … now you know too much. You’re a loose end. I don’t see a very bright future for you.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: You honestly expect me to believe a word you say?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah, it’s up to you. It’s your life. Just tell me everything about how you got backstage and I’ll keep you safe. If not, I can’t help you. Nobody can.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just think about it. Um, but don’t think too long.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if Chambers isn’t our shooter then what was he doing backstage?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He wanted to make a political statement by confronting Lopez during his speech in front of the cameras. That way he knew that it would blow up on the 24 hour news cycle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Carl Shelton?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, it’s looking like Shelton may not be involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The billionaire industrialist with his grubby hands on the levers of power? Of course he’s involved! They were seen in the storage room.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s because Shelton realized that Chambers has crashed the event so he tried to talk him out of making a scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where did Chambers get the press pass from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Left for him. In his mailbox.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In his mailbox? By whom?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: An anonymous sympathizer contacted him through his website, left him the pass and instructions about where to wait backstage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, can I – can I just say, I know I have occasionally theorized that a conspiracy was afoot –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Occasionally?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - but this time a conspiracy really is afoot. Guys, Chambers was clearly being manipulated by a person or persons unknown into being backstage so he’d be the perfect patsy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would someone go to all that trouble to set him up as Lopez’s shooter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I may have an answer for that. Prelim ballistics reports. You were right. The shots did not come from where Chambers was standing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where did the shots come from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, based on trajectories the shots were fired from this position right here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The shooter was behind the lighting stanchion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why no one saw him. He took his shot and then he slipped out the back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s good concealment; no one would be able to spot him. But check out this angle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Carolyn Decker’s blocking Lopez.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That would explain why the assassin missed Lopez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless he didn’t miss him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Exactly. Carolyn Decker was almost square to the shooter and she’s the one who got hit center mass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, what if we’re looking at this the wrong way?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Carolyn Decker’s the real target.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, we’ll dig through her life, see if anyone had motive to do this.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: There’s something you should see first.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: This is from Eric Chambers' building. I was reviewing it to piece together his timeline when I saw this. He goes straight to Chambers' mailbox.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that is definitely not the mailman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must be leaving the press pass for Chambers. When was this?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Three hours before the shooting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can we get a look at this guy’s face?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Not a good one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s my brother-in-law. That’s Frank.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Are you sure that’s Frank Kelly?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. No question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, I know this is hard but … where was Frank during those shots?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: All right, I’ll keep eyes on him on stage. You got him back here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was on the other side of the curtain. He went into the ballroom to cover Lopez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you see him out there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So you don’t really know where he was. After the shots, how soon did he arrive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ten seconds, maybe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Long enough for him to get from the light stanchion to where you saw him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what are you saying here? That Frank killed Carolyn Decker? Why would he?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t know. But we need to consider the possibility. At the very least he was involved. So we’re bringing him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good. Because you know what? He’ll tell his side of the story. There’s an explanation for this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure there is, Ryan. And it would make us happier.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys, this is my brother-in-law. There’s no way he could be mixed up in something like this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, bro. I’m sorry to say that unis just tried to pick up Frank. As soon as he saw the patrol car he bolted. They lost him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Issue an APB. See if there’s any connection between Frank Kelly and Carolyn Decker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m going to go find Frank.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, Javi, but this is family here. I’ve got to do this one alone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I need to talk to Frank, Gwen.

utterance.speaker: GWEN KELLY
utterance.content: He’s not here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where is he, then?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Kevin, don’t you walk in here and start pointing fingers at your own family!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He ran! Why would he do that, Gwen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s he into?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Nothing!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know that look. Yeah, that’s the look you used to get when you’d sneak a cigarette and lie to mom about it. Look, Gwen, I’m here for you but I need to know the truth. What’s he into?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Things were tight last year. You know, both kids are at Saint Margaret’s now, and that costs an arm and a leg. But then some money started coming in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: From where?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Frank said that he was picking up extra work, but he never ran it through the company. It was always cash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How much cash?

utterance.speaker: GWEN
utterance.content: Over time … close to fifty grand. Kevin, you know Frank! You know he would never hurt a soul.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, then tell me where he is before he’s the one who gets hurt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any word from Ryan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not yet. It’s gotta be tough. Frank is like a brother to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe Frank isn’t in this as deep as we think. Esposito still hasn’t found anything connecting him to Carolyn Decker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, neither have I. I hate this part.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Going through a victim’s effects?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Especially a purse. Everything in it is just so intimate. It’s like you get a chance to see who a person really is. Or was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who was Carolyn Decker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, she was um … a workaholic. The daily alarm on her phone is set for 4AM and her calendar shows that she was completely dedicated to Pure Water Now. She has that handwritten letter from a little boy in Africa in her wallet thanking her. His village was almost completely wiped out by cholera, and then once they set up the water filtration system in the village, nobody died. She was actually making a difference.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you make a difference too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, not like her. Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s got a second phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’d you do, Frank?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Not what you’re thinking, man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s a nice touch, when you acted all surprised when I remembered Chambers was wearing a press pass. I mean, you weren’t surprised, Frank, because all along it was you who gave it to him. You hired me for this job because you knew that I would never suspect you. You knew you could steer the investigation.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No, no. It wasn’t like that. And nobody was ever supposed to get hurt.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell does that even mean? Carolyn Decker, she’s dead. I blame myself. All along it was you!

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Kev, I got myself into something and I can’t get myself out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How could you do this? How could you do this to Gwen and the kids? Look me in the eyes and tell me, did you kill Carolyn? Did you know her? Did you do it for the money?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I didn’t kill nobody.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You had to have done something, Frank. Where’d you get all that cash?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: The security thing – – ain’t going as good as I said. Times are tough, you know? I needed money so I made some cash on the side … by selling access.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of access?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Slipping people in backstage at a concert, passes to fringe journalists, you know, who can’t get in the front door. I swear to you, I didn’t know that press pass was going to Chambers. I’m just trying to provide for my family. For your sister. I thought of all people you’d understand that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who paid you for that pass?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No, I told you everything I know. And that’s all you’re going to get, because we both know what happens to cops in prison. I ain’t turning myself in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Frank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Frank!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well. Going to be a lot harder on my sister. But at least Frank isn’t our shooter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does he know who is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. He received five thousand dollars in an envelope along with an address of where to leave the press pass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who paid him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was contacted by an outfit called Manhattan Politics. Turns out it’s a front with a dead email address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever’s behind this set up Eric Chambers and used Frank to do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we trace the money?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No luck so far, though the bills are sequential so it probably came from a bank withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the envelope?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU pulled off a partial print, but it’s not enough to run against the database.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, given the texts we found on Carolyn Decker’s phone we may only have to check one name.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Alex will be discharged later today. And we are so grateful and humbled by the outpouring of support from all over the world. But it’s also a time of mourning for the tragic death of Carolyn Decker. My husband will honor her name by continuing to fight for the people of this country and for those whose voices aren’t always heard. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. What brings you here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This. It contained cash used to buy a press pass for Eric Chambers.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: A press pass? That’s how the assassin got in?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you should know. Your fingerprint is on the envelope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you during the shooting, Mrs. Lopez? Because we can’t account for you.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You can’t be suggesting that I tried to kill my husband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. No, no, no. We’re suggesting you tried to kill Carolyn Decker. And succeeded.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: That’s ridiculous. And despicable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are texts between your husband and Carolyn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Going back three years, when their affair first started.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s motive for murder, Mrs. Lopez.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, maybe it was purely personal, or maybe you saw her as a liability to your husband’s chances at becoming president. Either way, Carolyn Decker had to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you had to make sure it didn’t lead back to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you created a narrative where Mr. Lopez was being targeted by an assassin and Eric Chambers was the patsy. A plan which happened to raise your husband’s profile on the national stage, as we just saw. Well done.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: You don’t think I knew about the affair? I understood the deal I was making when I married Alex. And far from a liability, Carolyn was his behind the scenes advisor. She was conduit to major donors, who backed –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you during the shooting, Mrs. Lopez?

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: Alex and I have an agreement. I was at the hotel. Room 717. I can give you her name if it’s absolutely necessary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It will be. But it still doesn’t explain away your fingerprint.

utterance.speaker: MIA
utterance.content: This envelope is from Alex’s office. I know that because I ordered the stationery. I help out there sometimes. I sent letters to his constituents. I must have touched it at some point.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who else has access to those envelopes?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I’m afraid I don’t understand. So you think that one of my people played a part in this?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Well, that’s impossible. I personally vetted everyone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once we knew where to look, we matched the serial numbers on those bills to a withdrawal from your bank account.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: My bank account?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Specifically your campaign travel account.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: That can’t be. I’m the only one authorized to access the account. Just me. And Megan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is, oddly enough, the one who showed up on the bank security video making the withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: Alex, this is a mistake. I would never do this. I have no reason to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not exactly true. We looked into Carolyn’s texts again. She had misgivings about you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Carolyn believed that you could make it all the way to the presidency with the right team in place, but she didn’t think that Megan belonged on that team.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The thought of being cast aside was more than you could bear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you came up with a plan to eliminate your problem and win your boss the sympathy of a nation. Two birds with one stone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got a search warrant to look into your apartment, Megan. The coat that you were wearing tested positive for gunshot residue.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: You killed Carolyn. Megan, how – how could you do that?

utterance.speaker: MEGAN
utterance.content: How could I? How could you? When you started at city council I was putting signs on people’s lawns. I was passing out pamphlets in the freezing cold. I write your speeches. I craft your bills. I have invested my entire life in you, and doing whatever it is you need me to do. And I’ve done it well. That should count for something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Megan Brooks, you’re under arrest for the murder of Carolyn Decker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Backstabbing, adultery, and betrayal. That is why I hate politics. Representatives of the people should be honorable. They should be trustworthy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sure some of them are. But Washington could probably use a few more people that think the way you do. What’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, study materials.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For the captain’s exam. So you’re going to go for it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s the next step. I’m not sure if it’s the right one. Yet. But I figured I’d take the test, see how I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if you do well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then maybe that’ll make me decision for me. You ready to go home?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What am I going to tell her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The only thing you can. The truth.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I messed everything up. Even with a plea deal I’m going to jail.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, you don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Gwen’s going to hate me. For lying. And for not being the man I said I was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s strong, Frank. Stronger than you think.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
